test.name: Type-safe enumerations
test.description: Compile an xsd (containing a simplType with restriction base="xs:string" and xs:enumerations) using xjc, compile the resulting java files, create a object and check if the element has bound to enum type.

test.name: Generics
test.description: Complie an xsd (containing a sequence of unbounded elements) using xjc, compile the resulting java files, create a object and check if the elements are bound to a parameterized List.

testcase.name: Read-only partial binding
testcase.description: XJC a schema and compile the resulting java files. Create a Binder from the JAXBContext. Unmarshal a DOM Node (which corresponds to only a small portion of an xml) and verify the values of properties in the JAXBElement.

testcase.name: Updateable partial binding
testcase.description: XJC a schema and compile the resulting java files. Create a Binder from the JAXBContext. Unmarshal a DOM Node (which corresponds to only a small portion of an xml) to a JAXBElement. Change the values of properties in the JAXBElement and marshal it back. Check the marshalled xml for the updated values

test.name: Binder callbacks
test.description:
Test parameters passed to callback listeners.
6366498 (xjc creates uncompilable bindings)

testcase.name: Marshal event callbacks
testcase.description: Test that the source parameter is never null and always maps to an element or complex type.

testcase.name: Unmarshal event callbacks
testcase.description: Test that: target and parent parameters always map to an element or complex type; if parent passed to beforeUnmarshal is null, target is JAXBElement; if target passed to afterUnmarshal is JAXBElement, parent is null.

test.name: Unified JAXBContext
test.description:

test.name: Unified JAXBContext
test.description: XJC a schema and compile the resulting java files.Create a JAXBElement. Verify if the JAXBIntrospector's method return the expected values. Compile a java file which is annotated with @XMLRootElement, create a JAXBContext of the class and check if the JAXBIntrospector returns the expected values.

test.name: Marshal
test.description: Compare marshalled content trees to the expected content model.

testcase.name: Marshal
testcase.description:
Compile xsd having jaxb:baseType/@name="java.lang.Object", unmarshal an instance with elements having @xsi:type of the base type, marshal the resulting object, test that the root element has children.
6292189 (root element empty when instance with children marshalled)
6366498 (xjc creates uncompilable bindings)

testcase.name: Mapping Null Collection Elements
testcase.description: Compile a xsd having elements with nillable="true" using xjc, Create a content tree having null elements, Marshal the content tree and verify if the xml contains xsi:nil="true" corresponding to the null elements added in the content tree.

testcase.name: Marshal
testcase.description:
Compile xsd having jaxb:baseType/@name="java.lang.Object", unmarshal an instance with elements having @xsi:type of the base type, marshal the resulting object.
6303222 (marshalling unmarshalled object throws MarshalException)

testcase.name: Marshalling valid content trees
testcase.description: Compile a schema using xjc. Create a content tree and marshal the content tree. Verify the marshalled xml by checking whether its contents match with the JAXBElement's contents and validate the xml against the schema.

test.name: Disabling validation
test.description: XJC a schema, compile the java files.Create a Marshaller and an Unmarshaller for the JAXBContext. Unmarshal an invalid xml without turning validation on. Marshal an invalid object without validation.

testcase.name: Mapping annotations
testcase.description:
Negative testcase to check for minOccurs="1". Exception should be thrown when an xml with no occurrences(of the element) is validated against the generated schema.
6274398 (For @XmlElement(nillable=true), minOccurs is not set to "1" in the generated schema)

testcase.name: Mapping annotations
testcase.description: Generate an xsd file by compiling a java file(containing custom annotations) using schemagen,generate xjc bindings, and unmarshal an invalid xml.

testcase.name: Mapping annotations
testcase.description:
This testcase verifies the working of package-level annotation @XmlAccessorOrder, by setting @XmlAccessorOrder.value() to ALPHABETICAL and checking if the elements are in the alphabetical order in the generated schema.
6198196 (package-info.java: Weird compiler error)

testcase.name: Mapping annotations
testcase.description:
This testcase verifies the working of package-level annotation @XmlAccessorType, by setting @XmlAccessorType.value() to FIELD and checking if every non static, non transient field in a JAXB-bound class is automatically bound to XML, unless annotated by @XmlTransient.
6198196 (package-info.java: Weird compiler error)

testcase.name: Mapping annotations
testcase.description:
This testcase verifies the working of package-level annotation @XmlAccessorType, by setting @XmlAccessorType.value() to NONE and checking if none of the fields or properties is bound to XML unless they are specifically annotated with some of the JAXB annotations.
6198196 (package-info.java: Weird compiler error)

testcase.name: Mapping annotations
testcase.description:
This testcase verifies the working of package-level annotation @XmlAccessorType, by setting @XmlAccessorType.value() to PROPERTY and checking if every getter/setter pair in a JAXB-bound class is automatically bound to XML, unless annotated by @XmlTransient.
6198196 (package-info.java: Weird compiler error)

testcase.name: Mapping annotations
testcase.description:
This testcase verifies the working of package-level annotation @XmlAccessorType, by setting @XmlAccessorType.value() to PUBLIC_MEMBER and checking if every public getter/setter pair and every public field is automatically bound to XML, unless annotated by @XmlTransient.
6198196 (package-info.java: Weird compiler error)
